results.title: I Put My Money on the Weeping Mothers at the Tennessee State Capitol
results.abstract: Our state’s Republican supermajority has again done nothing in the face of the slaughter of our children.

results.adx_keywords: Arms Trade;Defense and Military Forces;International Relations;United States International Relations;Classified Information and State Secrets;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Putin, Vladimir V;Kim Jong-un;Russia;North Korea
results.byline: By Edward Wong and Julian E. Barnes
results.title: Kim Jong-un and Putin Plan to Meet in Russia to Discuss Weapons
results.abstract: Russia seeks more weaponry for its war in Ukraine, and a North Korean delegation recently traveled to Russia by train to plan for Mr. Kim’s visit this month, officials say.

media.caption: A photograph released by North Korean state news shows Kim Jong-un, right, with Sergei K. Shoigu, the Russian defense minister, in July. Mr. Kim is expected to travel to meet President Vladimir V. Putin in Russia.

results.adx_keywords: Elder Care;Dementia;Alzheimer's Disease;Nursing Homes;Group Homes and Supportive Housing;Weesp (Netherlands);Baerum (Norway);Bellmere (Australia);Europe;Australia
results.title: As Cases Soar, ‘Dementia Villages’ Look Like the Future of Home Care
results.abstract: A new generation of treatment facilities is aiming to integrate dementia patients with the communities around them, blurring lines between home and hospital.

media.caption: The Hogeweyk dementia village in Weesp, Netherlands, opened in 2009 as a new model for treating people with dementia. The facility resembles a quaint Dutch village, with a town square, restaurant and other amenities.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Mercenaries and Private Military Contractors;Russia;Cuba
results.title: Cuba Says Its Citizens Were Lured to Fight in Russia’s War in Ukraine
results.abstract: The Cuban government said it had begun criminal proceedings against a “trafficking network” that had been recruiting its citizens in both Russia and Cuba for Russia’s armed forces.

media.caption: A priest blessing conscripted men at a recruiting office in Moscow in 2022. The Russian government has taken a number of measures to bolster its military ranks.

results.title: This Simple Fix Could Help Anxious Kids
results.abstract: Overprotection may be making kids scared of the world. If so, wouldn’t the obvious solution be more independence?

results.title: 5 Hot Springs in Iceland That Aren’t the Blue Lagoon
results.abstract: Some say Iceland’s more than 600 geothermal springs are the secret to its citizens’ happiness. Here’s a selection of scenic waters in and around Reykjavik where you can test that theory.

media.caption: On the outskirts of Reykjavik, Sky Lagoon, which opened in 2021, is one of Iceland’s most luxurious geothermal pools.

results.abstract: On Tuesday, the city will start enforcing strict new rules on how and when New Yorkers can rent out homes using platforms like Airbnb and Vrbo.
